wikipedia_page.main: James Lee (born 21 April 1953 in Nuneaton, England) is a freelance continuity announcer and newsreader on BBC Radio 4 and the BBC World Service as well as providing links for BBC Radio 4 Extra.

response: BBC Radio 4 Extra is broadcast from Broadcasting House in central London, although due to the nature of the channel very little of the channel's content is broadcast live from there with even the continuity announcements being pre-recorded. The channel uses ten continuity announcers to link between programmes. Notable announcers include Wes Butters, Kathy Clugston, Jim Lee, David Miles, Susan Rae, Alex Riley, Alan Smith, Zeb Soanes, Chris Berrow and Steve Urquhart. Previous presenters, including those presenting Radio 7, include Penny Haslam, Helen Aitken, Rory Morrison and Michaela Saunders.
Jim Lee is a comic book artist.
Jim Lee may also refer to:
*21 April – Jim Lee, radio continuity announcer and newsreader
